intro: Stylidium caespitosum var. subbulbosum, commonly known as the tufted sun-orchid, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in a dense, spike-like arrangement. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. This variety is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
